intro: Psychotria urdanetensis, commonly known as the Urdanet Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale green flowers. It is typically found in humid, shaded environments such as montane forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
